title: Definitions
context: J. Medical Education Council [ยง304A-1701] Definitions. As used in this subpart: &ldquo;Centers for Medicaid and Medicare Services&rdquo; means the Centers for Medicaid and Medicare Services within the United States Department of Health and Human Services. &ldquo;Council&rdquo; means the medical education council created under section [304A-1703]. &ldquo;Graduate medical education&rdquo; means that period of clinical training of a physician following receipt of the medical doctor degree and prior to the beginning of an independent practice of medicine. &ldquo;Graduate medical education program&rdquo; means a graduate medical education training program accredited by the American Council on Graduate Medical Education. &ldquo;Healthcare training program&rdquo; means a healthcare training program that is accredited by a nationally-recognized accrediting body. [L 2006, c 75, pt of ยง2]
